instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
Got this board with just 1 resistor bad <RESISTOR>R6125</RESISTOR> (seems it was water damage just on 1 pin).

CHecked all resistors near <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and they are ok. When plug magsafe fan spins for 5 seconds than turns off and than spins again for ever.


CPU is getting warm, all rails are ok, i have vcore 1.8V, ALL SYS is 3.3V.  There is USB activity but there is no chime and video.


Any idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
"There is USB activity"
Activity for sure, not just power?

Did you try external monitor?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
On External monitor no signal.

think that just power on usb because usb with bootable os not flashing.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
There are more SPI Bus Series Termination resistors; some of them under PCH area, faraway of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
You must check the ones close to J6100, as all traces too.

Sometime, liquid damage on SPI area can cause BIOS corruption.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message: already checked all resistor and traces near <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and also new EFI with same result. Fan spins for 5-6 seconds, shuts down and turn on again without chiming and image

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
Reball SMC.
If still the same, heat CPU with quality flux...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
it was SMC. All clean near but have shit under chip. Now it is working fine. Thank you. 



What make u think it can be SMC?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no chime
threads.message:
Had liquid on SPI area, close enough to SMC.
I always recommend to reball SMC if detect liquid sign close to it.
Sometime need to reball it even if no visible signs on its area...
